title: EFF Teams Up With AV Comparatives to Test Android Stalkerware Detection by Major Antivirus Apps
summary: The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) collaborated with AV-Comparatives to assess the ability of major antivirus applications to detect Android stalkerware, malicious apps that enable unauthorized monitoring of internet users. The study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of these antivirus solutions in identifying and mitigating the risks posed by stalkerware, which can compromise user privacy and security. Findings from the evaluation highlighted varying levels of detection success among different antivirus apps, underscoring the need for improved measures in recognizing and countering such threats.

title: CISA orders feds to patch Samsung zero-day used in spyware attacks
summary: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has mandated that federal agencies address a zero-day vulnerability discovered in Samsung devices, which has been exploited in spyware attacks. This directive underscores the urgency of mitigating potential security risks posed by the flaw, as it could be leveraged by malicious actors to infiltrate and compromise sensitive government systems.
